gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.data

Class IntervalData

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.data.IntervalData

  • public final class IntervalData
extends Object
    Static utilities for working with and concrete implementations of 1-, 2- and 3-dimensional interval data containers.
    Author:
    Peter Powers
    See Also:
    IntervalArray, IntervalTable, IntervalVolume

    • Method Detail

      • keys

        public static double[] keys(double min,
                            double max,
                            double Δ)
        Create key values for use in an IntervalArray, IntervalTable or IntervalVolume. These classes call this method directly when initializing their backing arrays. It is exposed for convenience as there are circumstances where a reference to the row or column keys is helpful to have when working with the builders for these classes. Internally, this method calls Data.buildCleanSequence(double, double, double, boolean, int) with a precision value of 4 decimal places. This may change in the future.

        Example: keys(5.0, 8.0, 1.0) returns [5.5, 6.5, 7.5]

        Parameters:
        min - lower edge of lowermost bin
        max - upper edge of uppermost bin
        Δ - bin width

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(double min,
                          double delta,
                          double value,
                          int size)
        Compute an index from a minimum value, a value and an interval.
        Parameters:
        min - value
        delta - interval (i.e. bin width)
        value - for which to compute index
        size - of array or collection for which index is to be used
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index of value falls outside the allowed index range of [0, size-1].
        IllegalArgumentException - if size is negative
